I think I've invented a new format for upfront talk events:
Timebox: 10min
Vote:
üëç 10 more mins
üëê Great, but next
üëé Next topic/speaker, pls
Worked super good tonight with 3 speakers... #donnerstalk https://t.co/CwInM4FaJe
https://t.co/YVApwSfctt contains in interesting rant on working as an open source maintainer.
@jke the person watching the timebox should be empathic to them, and don't use a public timer ...

@jke but yes, we were 3 experienced speakers, so we could handle. 
Audience loved it and made good use of their options!
@ldwg Yeah, usually you can extend, especially if the audience is following you. That pushes! But sometimes a speaker must say "I'm done"!
@ldwg well, for use one other person (Host, non-speaker) is doing the timebox. Also some wiggle room should be in there.
@ldwg we had a silent timer and intervened when there was good opportunity within 1-2 Minutes.
@ldwg Oh, and make a PWA out of it, so I can use it on my Android and in Laptops ‚Ä¶ I don't have an iPhone.
@ldwg interesting, that you went iOS first ‚Ä¶
@ldwg at @RH_Way we've developed @caRHds to take meeting optimization to a whole new level. Everyone is made accountable for the outcome.

How to encourage newcomers to integrate, especially if their local community doesn't encourage that? Make great examples known! #otc17
We are in a post #integration society. #integration assumes there is a single entity in which one can be integrated. #otc17
"As a migrant, I need to know what integration means, what is expected. I don't know that right now." #otc17

Don't give help without asking. Educate newcomers how to express their needs so they are able to take an active role in the act. #otc17
